title.name: Title
notes: Last, First

_id.name: ID
notes: any field where the key starts with an underscore is generated by WiX
...and cannot be altered for any given record or deleted from the table

_owner.name: Owner
notes: any field where the key starts with an underscore is generated by WiX
...and cannot be altered for any given record or deleted from the table

_createdDate.name: Created Date
notes: any field where the key starts with an underscore is generated by WiX
...and cannot be altered for any given record or deleted from the table

_updatedDate.name: Updated Date
notes: any field where the key starts with an underscore is generated by WiX
...and cannot be altered for any given record or deleted from the table

idPP.name: Primary Parent ID
idPP.source: WiX Velo by way of automated Parent Membership
idPP.usage: used to connect Parent with Member with any and all Enrollments for her/his children
notes: in a sense this makes Family ID redundant, but still good to have Family ID so that it is its own thing
in geek talk, using the Family ID makes everything more 'extensible'

idFM.name: Family ID
idFM.usage: used to connect Parent with Member with any and all Enrollments for her/his children
notes: from the perspective of the Student there is only ONE Family
same as idPP for simplicity accross tables

idHH.name: Household ID
idHH.source: WiX Velo by way of automated Parent Membership
idHH.usage: used to connect Parent with Member with any and all Enrollments for her/his children
notes: from the perspective of the Student the _First_ HH _is_ the PP's HH'
therefore, same as idPP for simplicity accross tables

idBL.name: Billing ID
idBL.usage: used to connect Parent with Member with any and all Enrollments for her/his children
notes: ONLY for PP Person at present
this exists for putative use as billing gets more complicated
by way of _being_ PP there is implied Billing 'ownership'
for present it will be ignored, but maybe divorced couple both pay half

idWix.name: Wix ID
idWix.source: Either Wix ContactID or Wix MemberID
idWix.usage: used for individual CRM tasks with individuals NOT the PP
notes: ONLY for PP Person at present
since PP _is_ a Member, the Contact/Member ID is expected to be identical
if at a later time we _can_ extract a ContactID, we will _here_
however, it may be that this value is _unused_ until we assign Students (others) as Members
since, it appears that ContactID and MemberID are identical, no change when become Members
...NOTE: CodeQueen says there are exceptions, so watch this
NOT the '_id' value of this table

role.name: Role
role.source: enrollment logic or other editing logic
role.usage: determin query behavior, notwithstanding the intentional redundancy of IDs

comboName.name: Parent Last
notes: perhaps null other than students
perhaps some combo-couple name for parents, but not critical
perhaps something else for other roles

jsonData.name: Enrollment JSON
jsonData.usage: this holds all the data about the Parent(s) and the Student and the current enrollment Enrollment
notes: the Holy Grail
this can be used to Enroll a Student programatically
at the outset, generating this record and actual enrollment will be two separate tasks with two spearate clicks
eventually, this will happen instantaneously
still two separate tasks, but done one after the other by code so it seems like one task

jsonCorollary.name: Corollary JSON
notes: since the enrollmentOJson is the Holy Grail, there needs to be a place for any number of additional datapoints
none at first so an empty object will be iserted
eventually, additional data that is not _intrinsic_ to the enrollmentJson, but is as yet unknown
there may come a time where the code harvesting the enrollmentJson is _so_ stable
...that we use this corollaryJson for true enrollment data, but for the sake of not entering a potential bug this is used
again, this offers nearly unlimited extensibility

jsonStatusNotes.name: Status Notes JSON
jsonStatusNotes.usage: discrete values to describe the status of the Enrollment

notes: different values by 'role'
primaryParent: of course, this can be anything
...but the idea a collection of one word values that succicntly capture the, well, Status
